module.name: activity_structure_and_classification
module.keywords: module, individual, class, activity, action, process, library, structure

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record:

ul.li: individual activities with their whole-part, connection and involvement relationships;
a library of classes of activity with their whole-part, connection and involvement relationships;
the classification of an individual activity as a member of a class of activity, and the classification of a relationship between individual activities as a member of a class of relationship; and
the specification of the complete membership for a class of activity or a class of relationship between activities.

li.p: the existence of an individual activity;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_activity_structure application module.

li.p: a whole-part relationship between two individual activities;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_activity_structure application module.

li.p: a connection relationship between two individual activities;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_activity_structure application module.

li.p: an involvement of a product, document, person, organization or other activity in an individual activity;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_activity_structure application module.

li.p: the existence of a class of activity;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_library application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of activity and another that indicates the nature of a whole-part relationship between two individual activities;
li.note: A mapping between classes of activity is a class that has relationships between individual activities as members.
This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_library application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of activity and another that indicates the nature of a connection relationship between two individual activities;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_library application module.

li.p: a mapping between a class of activity and another class that indicates the nature of an involvement in an activity;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_library application module.

li.p: set theory relationships, such as subset, union and intersection, between classes of activity and between mappings;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_library application module.

li.p: the classification of an individual activity as a member of a class of activity;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Classification application module. The application of the capability to the classification of activities is specified by this part of ISO 10303.

li.p: the classification of a relationship between individual activities as a member of a mapping;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Classification application module. The application of the capability to the classification of relationships between activities is specified by this part of ISO 10303.

li.p: the specification of the complete membership of a class of activity or of a mapping between classes of activity.
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Classification application module. The application of the capability to classes of activity or relationships between classes of activity is specified by this part of ISO 10303.

li.p: reference to an externally defined class of activity or activity relationship.
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced External_item_identification_assignment application module. The application of the capability to classes of activity or relationships between classes of activity is specified by this part of ISO 10303.

note.p: Product structure and classification for products that are not documents is within the scope of the Product_structure_and_classification application module.
The assignment of a property is within the scope of the Property_and_property_assignment application module.

uof.name: activity_structure_and_classification
uof.description: The activity_structure_and_classification UOF provides the ability to record information about classes of activity and individual activities, their structure, and classification relationships between classes and individuals.
